title: your opinion on HoTS?
body: I think its good if not better. what about you lot?

replies.body: I'm enjoying it, don't think I'd drop LoL entirely but it's fun.

Last time I played it (months ago) I thought it was pretty good however I couldn't get past the in-game levelling system. I know it's a team game but there's only so much trust you can put into randoms on the internet, and the way I see it that system pretty much promotes trolling/feeding. I made a post on the forums about it but no one gave a sh!t, the one defence they kept rushing to is "it's a team game" so I just gave up and left them to deal with the trouble makers.

One other thing, and it's probably changed by now, I could never find a match with other players, not even VS AI, regardless of when I queued.

It's just not a system I see working in the intended manner under normal circumstances.

i have hearthstone, its pretty fun but I lost the energy to persist with it.
I pretty much play hots, evolve, league (though less now), and if I could be bothered hearthstone.

ofc if I had day of defeat I would play that, I miss the community on there. 

honoustly the main reason I like hots is because all of the players share the experience pool, and you start with all your abilities (part from your ultimate), this makes people not even care about who gets the kills or what items you buy (since theres no in game shop, it takes a bit to get used to)

flame level: 0-5/100
lol flame level: 78-93/100

so yeah, I find it way more enjoyable just because of its more friendly community. not to say league is bad but its community and pressure can get a bit too much to bother with

I think LOL has lost it's sense of community, but I believe it can get it back. 
The focus in the game currently is too focused on in game mechanics, and not focused enough of out-of-game strategy. 
I think the fun thing with LOL is that you can be constantly thinking about different combinations of champs, different builds. 
I just don't think there are enough tool out there to do so yet.

well in HOTS rather than being buffed by tools you gain a perk or "talent" every few levels (4/7/10/13/16/20) that makes your abilities more potent or gives you access to other benefits. 
so in effect its got the same objective as items and builds but it's just laid out differently.
so it's not really lacking like that it's just.. different. 

I thought that's what you meant by "I just don't think there are enough tools out there to do so yet." , you could have been referring to building a community though lol, if so I think that the community kind-a dropped off when the lore dropped off. people don't think about anything related to league apart from in-game because there's no content to discuss until a juicy patch gets dropped in, and even then people just complain about it.
maybe if it had some community management staff or something to try and motivate people to get involved, but apart from that it seems pretty dead.

although play with riot was great (Riot Jimz is my senpai) the game is lacking in background interest. now its just about technical decisions and it kind of rips a bit of the game away. just my opinion though.

Many of my ideas are to make strategy accessible and fun to all players. 
It's hard to share all my ideas, but I have hope to rejuvenate the LOL community, I just need time.

I guess the ~~forums ~~ boards are more quiet, but in all honesty I prefer boards. 
I like that comments and replies can be nested, so there are the different and separated conversations.
I like the upvote/downvote for ordring.
I like that toxic reports can be reported and are removed. 
Less circle jerking and attention seeking trolls as well.

People are resistant to change, but overall I think boards allows potential for a happier community experience.
